name: Limulus xiphosura

Head: Mental depression
Difficult to remember names, confused with heat of face, rush of blood to face, worse when meditating
Pain behind left eye-ball
Stomach: Painful fullness of whole right side of body
Nose: Pressure above nose and behind eyes
Skin: Itching spots and vesicles on face and hands
Extremities: Soles of feet ache, feel numb

details: Bodily and mental exhaustion; drowsiness AFTER SEA BATHING.Limulus was introduced by C. Hering and partially proved by him and Lippe. Hering was surprised to see the blood of the King crab that he dissected, blue, which on investigation, was found to contain copper as he had surmised and which he thought would prove to be another medicine for Cholera. Further provings are necessary to establish this, though symptoms so far observed make this probable. Hering's fertile mind always lead him to pioneer paths into practical therapeutics.
